intro: Echinochloa occidentalis, commonly known as western稗, is a grass species native to the Americas. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. It thrives in wetland and marshy environments, often found in disturbed soils. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
